chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavontae M Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber.  Standard release conditions.  The Court grants 48 days credit if revoked.
Probation maybe transferred to Milwaukee County if accepted by the Agent.

miscConds.notes: Any money on deposit in cases 22CM385 and 22CM397 to be applied to this matter.  Remainder of Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with any business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lavontae M Williams in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   State of Wisconsin Atty Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
All parties have received and reviewed the doctors report.
Atty Miller agrees with the report that the Defendant is competent.  State also agrees with the doctors report. 
Court does find the defendant competent in this matter and will proceed.
Atty Miller requests to pass case in order to go through plea paperwork at the jail with the Defendant. 
No parties object.  Court will recall this matter later this afternoon.  

MATTER RECALLED at 4:08 pm  Same appearances. 
Atty Miller requests to waive preliminary heairng.
Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant as to waiver of preliminary hearing.
  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files information. 
Defense accepts receipt of the information and waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.

Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5. 
Court dismisses and reads in Cases 22CM385 and 22CM397. 

Court orders the following:
 6 MONTHS  Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
48 Days credit if revoked
STAYED for PROBATION

Term of Probation: 3 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 Random U.A.'s ; 
 No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
 No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 No contact with:  any business listed in the criminal complaint.
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Probation maybe transferred to Milwaukee County if accepted by the agent.

Any monies posted in 22CM385 or 22CM397 to be applied to this matter.

  Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

DEFENDANT TO BE RELEASED FORTHWITH.
filed by Atty. Miller
prepared by Dr. Jenna Niess

03:35 PM Defendant Lavontae M Williams in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an inpatient basis within 30 days.  Review hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
